english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: The Prophet ﷺ established brotherhood (alliance) between the Muhajirin and the Ansar in my house which is in Al-Madinah.

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: The merit and goodness of all Ansar houses mentioned by the Prophet ﷺ

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Usayd al-Sa'idi (or his father): The Prophet ﷺ was asked: Which houses of the Ansar are best? He said: The houses of Banu al-Najjar, then Banu al-Ashhal, then Banu al-Harith ibn al-Khazraj, then Banu Sa'idah. He then said: In all houses of the Ansar there is good.

english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik and Abu Usayd al-Sa'idi: The Prophet ﷺ said: The best houses of the Ansar are: Banu al-Najjar, then Banu Abd al-Ashhal, then Banu al-Harith ibn al-Khazraj, then Banu Sa'idah, and in all houses of the Ansar there is good. Then Saad ibn Mu'adh said: I do not see the Messenger of Allah ﷺ except that he has placed us (Banu Sa'idah) at the end.

chainIssues: Qatadah is a known mudallis (category 3) who uses 'an (عَنْ) with Anas - however, Qatadah is still Thabt (reliable) and this is acceptable per classical hadith principles as his tadlis is not severe

potential_issues.issue: Qatadah is classified as a category 3 mudallis by Ibn Hajar and uses 'an (عَنْ) with Anas
potential_issues.impact: While Qatadah's tadlis is a concern, he is still Thabt (reliable) and many scholars accept his narrations, especially with Anas who he is known to have heard from. This does not significantly affect the overall reliability grade

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn Jafar is Saduq, not Thiqah
potential_issues.impact: Slightly reduces the chain reliability but not significantly problematic given the strength of other narrators

english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: The Prophet ﷺ said: Shall I not inform you of the best houses of the Ansar? Banu al-Najjar, then those who are near them (from) Banu Abd al-Ashhal, then those who are near them (from) Banu al-Harith ibn al-Khazraj, then those who are near them (from) Banu Sa'idah. And in all houses of the Ansar there is good.

english_translation: Narrated by Anas: When the Messenger of Allah ﷺ arrived in Madinah, the Prophet ﷺ established brotherhood between Abd al-Rahman and Sa'd ibn al-Rabi'. Sa'd said to him: 'The Ansar know that I am the wealthiest among them, so I will divide my wealth with you in half, and I have two wives, so see which one you prefer and I will divorce her, and when her waiting period ends, you can marry her.' Abd al-Rahman said: 'May Allah bless you in your family and wealth. Show me the market.'
